III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last night (6/30/25), a youth was sitting in their feces for two
hours. It is believed that the staff responsible was aware, but was
waiting for shift change for another staff to change the youth. The
youth was given a tablet instead of being changed. The youth
was changed by the staff that took over.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 7/2/25.
Complainant reported she did not have any additional information.
Youth A is non-verbal and could not be interviewed.
Consultant observed Youth A face to face at the facility on 7/2/25
and no concerns were noted.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/2/25.
Director reported the incident occurred on 6/30/25 in the
afternoon, at the beginning of 2nd shift. Director reported Youth A
had his tablet at the time of the incident, but according to Youth
A’s treatment plan, he should not have had his tablet at that time.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 7/7/25. Staff 1 reported
she was assigned to Youth A as a 1:1 staff for approximately 1 ½
hours before she left 1st shift (approximately 2:30pm). Staff 1
reported Youth A requested tablet time, so she allowed him to.
Staff 1 reported he was in his room during the duration she was
assigned as his staff, and she completed 15 minute checks on him
throughout the entire time. Staff 1 reported he has a sheet with
pictures on it for “bathroom, tablet, etc.” and he uses that to
communicate his needs. Staff 1 reported she has been working at
the facility for 3 months and doesn’t know Youth A extremely well
but knows him well enough. Staff 1 reported Youth A makes
certain movements when he has to use the bathroom, and he
never made those movements or showed her the picture to tell her
he needed to use the bathroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A is really
good at telling staff when he needs to use the bathroom, therefore
she didn’t have any concerns about him notifying her. Staff 1
reported each time she checked on him in his room, she walked
2

fully into his room and asked if he was okay. Staff 1 reported each
time she went into Youth A’s room, he was on his tablet and
responded with a thumbs up sign saying he was okay. Staff 1
reported he and his room did not smell like feces, and he never
had any feces on his body or anywhere else when she entered his
room. Staff 1 reported when she completed her checks, she
documented them on the sheet in his binder and completed all
necessary paperwork for his behavior and bathroom needs during
the time she was assigned as his staff. Staff 1 reported she was
shocked when she heard about the incident from Chief
Administrator because Youth A was fine when she did her checks.
Staff 1 reported she could not remember who she handed Youth
A’s binder to at the end of her shift, but he was the team lead for
2nd shift on 6/30/25.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 7/2/25. Staff 2 reported he
arrived for 2nd shift on 6/30/25 around 2:00pm and he was
scheduled to be the team leader for the shift. Staff 2 reported he
completed paperwork for the first 15 minutes and then entered the
milieu around 2:15pm. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was assigned to
Youth A on 1st shift and when Staff 2 went out to the milieu, Staff 1
was sitting on her phone. Staff 2 reported by 2:30pm, Staff 1 was
leaving for the day, and she still hadn’t completed a room check
on Youth A because she was still on her phone. Staff 2 reported
he went to check on Youth A in his room at 2:30pm and found
Youth A sitting in his own fecal matter. Staff 2 reported the fecal
matter was dried on, and Youth A had smeared it all over himself
(arms, legs, chest, etc.). Staff 2 reported Youth A had his tablet,
which is against Youth A’s protocol as he is not supposed to have
it until 6:30pm. Staff 2 reported he took Youth A to the bathroom,
cleaned him up and switched Youth A to his assigned 2nd shift
staff. Staff 2 reported he checked Youth A’s bathroom log, which
showed the last documented time he was taken to the bathroom
was 12:32pm. Staff 2 reported Youth A is supposed to be taken to
the bathroom every hour per his bathroom protocol. Staff 2
reported he checked Youth A’s bed check logs and saw there was
no documentation for any bed checks completed since Youth A
went to the bathroom at 12:32pm. Staff 2 reported he did not know
how long Youth A was sitting in his own feces, but it was long
enough for it to be dried on, so he guessed it was at least 40
minutes. Staff 2 reported there have been at least two other
instances of Staff 1 being talked to about being on her phone
rather than paying attention to the youth. Staff 2 reported he
wasn’t a part of those conversations but was aware of them
occurring.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/2/25.
Staff 3 reported he was the team leader on 1st shift on 6/30/25;
however, he was not aware of the incident and was not told about
the incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 7/8/25. Staff 4 reported he
was not assigned to Youth A on 6/30/25 and didn’t see him or
Staff 1 much that day. Staff 4 reported he was not aware of the
incident and did not have any further information.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 7/7/25. Staff 5 reported
during shift change on 6/30/25, he was supposed to take over for
Youth A for 2nd shift, but he was with a different youth. Staff 5
reported Staff 2 was the team leader for 2nd shift and completed a
bed check on Youth A. Staff 5 reported when Staff 2 completed
the check, Staff 2 found Youth A had soiled himself, and it looked
like he had been soiled for a long time. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
took Youth A to the bathroom to clean him up. Staff 5 reported he
could not remember the name of the staff assigned to Youth A for
1st shift, but she was a newer female employee. Staff 5 reported
he did not know what the female employee was doing when she
was supposed to be checking on Youth A because he was
focused on the youth he was assigned to.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Mobile Devices and Personal Phone Use policy states it is
not possible to implement the agency’s mission, vision, and
values unless staff are fully present, emotionally and
physically, while at work. Therefore, the use of electronic
communications devices by employees while at work is
allowed only with the express permission of a supervisor.
Phone use while working can present safety risks to
individuals served and can cause distractions to
employees, which can cause harm. Safety concerns must
always be made a priority.
• Youth A’s Toileting Protocol states Youth A should be
prompted every hour to use the bathroom if he does not
independently. Youth A self-initiates by signing “bathroom”
or using the “bathroom” icon.
• Youth A’s toileting and data sheet dated 6/30/25 does not
show any toileting information after 12:32 pm.
• Incident report dated 6/30/25, authored by Staff 2 states
Staff 2 performed a 15 minute bed check on [Youth A] at
2:35pm when it was found [Youth A] had an accident in his
pants which he had been digging in and smearing all over
his hands, arms, chest, and back. Staff 2 cleaned Youth A
4

up and left him in the care of the next staff for second shift.
It was reported to management. After reporting to
management, Staff 2 investigated the binder to find the last
documented bathroom trip was at 12:32pm and there were
no documented 15 minute checks by the previous staff.
Information was reported to management and Recipient
Rights.
• Youth A’s Updated Service Plan dated 3/5/25 states [Youth
A] may have access to his personal tablet after dinner, until
bedtime.
• Staff 1 has two disciplinary records in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 does not have any
documentation of discipline surrounding inappropriate
phone use. Staff 1 was terminated from the facility on
7/3/25 for reasons unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1
was trained on youth plans, youth protocols and facility
policies during orientation, shadow shifts, and IRT2 training
in March and April 2025.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per interviews conducted and
documentation reviewed, Staff 1 did not follow Youth A’s
treatment plan regarding tablet use, did not follow Youth A’s
toileting protocol, and did not follow the facility’s cell phone policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR#2025SIC0000010 dated 11/8/24; CAP approved 11/22/24
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not complete observation checks while a youth was in
their bedroom.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 7/7/25. Staff 1 reported
she was assigned to Youth A as a 1:1 staff for approximately 1 ½
hours before she left her shift (approximately 2:30pm). Staff 1
reported he was in his room during the duration she was assigned
as his staff, and she completed 15 minute checks on him
throughout the entire time. Staff 1 reported when she completed
her checks, she documented them on the sheet in his binder and
completed all necessary paperwork for his behavior and bathroom
needs during the time she was assigned as his staff.
5

Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 7/2/25. Staff 2 reported he
arrived for 2nd shift on 6/30/25 around 2:00pm and he was
scheduled to be the team leader for the shift. Staff 2 reported he
completed paperwork for the first 15 minutes and then entered the
milieu around 2:15pm. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was assigned to
Youth A on 1st shift and when Staff 2 went out to the milieu, Staff 1
was sitting on her phone. Staff 2 reported by 2:30pm, Staff 1 was
leaving for the day, and she still hadn’t completed a room check
on Youth A because she was still on her phone. Staff 2 reported
he went to check on Youth A in his room at 2:30pm and found
Youth A sitting in his own fecal matter. Staff 2 reported he
checked Youth A’s bed check logs and saw there was no
documentation for any bed checks completed since Youth A went
to the bathroom at 12:32pm.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 6/30/25, authored by Staff 2 states
Staff 2 performed a 15 minute bed check on [Youth A] at
2:35pm. Staff 2 investigated the binder to find there were
no documented 15 minute checks by the previous staff.
• Supervision Practice Policy states supervision in which a
staff does not continuously monitor a resident’s well-being
but instead performs a visual check of the resident
(minimally every 15 minutes).
• Youth A’s data sheet dated 6/30/25 shows Staff 1 signed
off on checks for Youth A between 1:15-1:30pm, 1:30-
1:45pm, 1:45-2:00pm, 2:00-2:15pm, and 2:15-2:30pm.
There is no spot to write the exact time she completed each
of the checks to know whether it was in line with the
licensing rule.
• Staff 1 has two disciplinary records in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 does not have any
documentation of discipline surrounding inappropriate
phone use. Staff 1 was terminated from the facility on
7/3/25 for reasons unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1
was trained on facility policies during orientation, shadow
shifts, and IRT2 training in March and April 2025.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per documentation reviewed, it
is unclear when Staff 1 completed observation checks on Youth A,
or whether those checks met the requirement of variable interval
checks not to exceed 15 minutes since 15-minute timeframes are
prefilled on the youth data sheets. Based on Staff 2’s interview
and the incident report completed; it seems clear checks were not
completed as required since Youth A was sitting in his own feces
long enough for it to be dried on his skin.
6

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
• The facility was provided technical assistance regarding
Youth A’s Service Plan Monitoring Prompts as it stated,
“During sleep hours, staff will visually check on [Youth A]
every 15 minutes”. Facility was notified they needed to
ensure all youths’ plans coincide with the requirements of
the rule, which includes variable interval checks not to
exceed 15 minutes whenever a youth is in their bedroom
(not just during sleeping hours).
• The facility should also update their youth data sheets to be
consistent with the licensing rule. Currently, the times are
pre-filled with 15 minute intervals, which does not meet the
requirement of the licensing rule as it is unknown when the
staff completed the visual check since the staff do not fill
out the time they completed the check. For example, a staff
could complete a check at 1 pm (between 1-1:15pm time
slot) and not complete another check until 1:30pm
(between 1:15-1:30pm timeslot). The staff would meet the
requirements currently listed on the data sheet, but do not
meet the licensing requirements. Data sheets should not
include pre-filled out timeframes.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
